TopicTitle: FTL - Faster Than Light... is HARD!

Articles.Content:
God, I've died so many times I can't even count.

I *will* beat this game!

On one of my tries, with a non-updraged Kestrel except for shields and power, I made it to the boss. But I died pretty quick.

It's good to scrap-mine the sector if you can, and get lots of missiles. But it's mainly so hard because of how random it is.You might miss, you might hit, you might get a crew member killed by giant spiders, etc...

FTL is one of my very favorite games. I can win almost 100% of the time with the ships I like, and 50/50 or so with the ships I don't like so much. On Hard mode. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
Welcome to roguelike in space

> 
> FTL is one of my very favorite games. I can win almost 100% of the time with the ships I like, and 50/50 or so with the ships I don't like so much. On Hard mode. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Same here ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

It's all about knowing what is a trap and when you can risk it ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) And while the game's RNG can mess you up bad, there's always something you can do to win not die as quickly.

EDIT: Alright, I just checked my stats in FTL... 189 runs, 40 victories. Not all that impressive ![:sealed:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_lipssealed.gif) (But I think at least 60 of those were Rock B runs to unlock Crystal A, most of them just manually restarted)

Good luck Starwhip and anyone struggling, that first victory will feel *so good*

I remember having such a good playthrough, a little while ago...

But in one of the later sectors, a crew of 6 teleported onto my ship and started killing everything... I jumped ONCE, but I still died.

The really annoying part is when you get an awesome ship, upgrade the heck out of it, head into the final sector feeling like you're going to blast the boss to pieces... and then you die on the first stage of the Flagship.

And once, the final sector had all the repair bases in a perfect line, as far as possible as they could be from the main base.

Gotta love RNGs!

While strategy does exist, it's still about spamming restarts until the RNG has mercy, though. How is that satisfying?

I have found that the secret to winning is to know what to do for many situations. Make a mistake and BOOM!, you're dead.

For example, one time I was boarded and I vented the whole ship, which, when left with only one guy and a destroyed Oxygen room, left me with no chance to win. If I did something else, maybe I wouldn't have died...

> 
> While strategy does exist, it's still about spamming restarts until the RNG has mercy, though. How is that satisfying?

It's not. And once you get really good at the game you don't need to rely on the RNG to have mercy. You will face those "impossible" situations and scrape by. Then you'll dominate. Finally, you'll flourish.

I am dead serious here. 99% of the "oh the RNG screwed me" moments ARE surmountable. If not at the time they happen, then because your ship should have been better prepared and your choices prior to that event were not the best. And I'm not talking that you need prescience to avoid the situation. I'm saying that if you build your ship up in a good way you will just naturally be better able to face those events.

For example, with the exception of missiles most ships in the first 2 sectors can't get through 2 shields. So you should spend your \*first\* 50 scrap on shields. Don't bother with the power, just get those shields. Every time you face a ship with 2 shots, or a single shot and a beam, power down your engines (who cares about dodging when you're invincible?) and put on your shields. Then, take your time tearing the enemy apart. That alone can net you HUNDREDS of risk-free scrap to use to upgrade your engines, buy a nice new weapon, or take advantage of something you find floating in space.

> 
> While strategy does exist, it's still about spamming restarts until the RNG has mercy, though. How is that satisfying?

What? I respectfuly disagree. It's a roguelike. It's about doing with what little you have against bad odds. It's about learning the game through dying. It's about the feeling you get when you beat the game, even when the game is trying hard to beat you. And beating the game through strategy alone is very much possible, even consistently.

Spamming restarts until you get a carry run is not satisfying. It's also not how the game is meant to be played.

If strategy isn't your cup of tea, don't waste your money on a strategy game. ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)
